docs.lead_paragraph: International NEIGHBORS CHALLENGE ENERGY AIMS IN BOLIVIA
docs.snippet: International     NEIGHBORS CHALLENGE ENERGY AIMS IN BOLIVIA

docs.lead_paragraph: Displaying images of fetuses on her computer screen, Dr. Choi Anna described what happens to them during an abortion. For years, she said, she washed her hands in contrition after each one she performed. Her colleague Dr. Shim Sang-duk said that until it halted the practice in September, their Ion Women's Clinic in Seoul did 30 abortions a month, twice the number of babies delivered there. Nearly all were illegal.

headline.main: A Korean Doctors' Group Wants to Halt Abortions

docs.abstract: Group of South Korean doctors held November news conference to ask forgiveness for performing abortions, which are widespread though generally illegal in South Korea; doctors hope to force first serious public discussion of ethics of procedure; abortion carries little emotional and religious significance in South Korea, but effort is gaining attention as government looks for ways to reverse declining birthrate; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats have long maintained that they must pass their health care legislation in part because failure to do so would be a political disaster.

headline.main: Overhaul Success or Not, Democrats Brace for Losses

docs.abstract: It does not necessarily follow that passage of a health care reform bill will help Democrats in the midterm elections.
docs.snippet: It does not necessarily follow that passage of a health care reform bill will help Democrats in the midterm elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: OK, clearly I have to weigh in on this. Should there be a limit to the tax deductibility of employer-provided health insurance, which is what the excise tax in the Senate bill is supposed to fix?
docs.abstract: Bottom line: the details of the excise tax should be fixed, but it's on balance a good idea.
docs.snippet: Bottom line: the details of the excise tax should be fixed, but it's on balance a good idea.

docs.lead_paragraph: Against the backdrop of Friday's economic news that the nation maintained a 10-percent unemployment rate in December, President Obama touted the economic benefits and safeguards built into his health care bill in comments this morning.
docs.abstract: The president talks about health care while the Republicans focus on national security.
docs.snippet: The president talks about health care while the Republicans focus on national security.

docs.lead_paragraph: On July 12, the Op-Ed page published an article by Jonathan Gruber, a professor of economics at M.I.T., on health insurance and taxation. On Friday, Professor Gruber confirmed reports that he is a paid consultant to the Department of Health and Human Services, and that his contract was in effect when he published his article. The article did not disclose this relationship to readers.
